review_title: Great place to work in a small town atmosphere
pros:
Great work/life balance
Amazing work hours
Fair compensation and benefits
cons: Sometimes extra work is unavailable due to size and especially after the COVID epidemic.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Viroqua, WI
pros: Good pay, ok benefits and great coworkers
cons: Huge disconnect between supervisor and staff, major favoritism and lack of professionalism within the Dept

pros:
Caring
Close to home
Good pay for role

The biggest pro has retired and left the organization.  Garith Steiner was a visionary and strong leader who secured the future of the organization by forming a partnership with Gundersen Lutheran and specializing in Orthopedic surgeries.  Surgeries fill hospital beds and consume radiology and therapy services.  Two surgeons have left since Garith retired.
cons: Garith was replaced with an inexperienced, uneducated local guy with a high school education and no leadership skills. He has no values and does not have the leadership qualities to withstand the challenges coming from heathcare reform.  He is dispised by staff and is not trusted.  Staff fear for their jobs, physicians included.

pros: Reasonable pay. Good benefits. Good staff.
cons: Do not come to work here, it will be the worst experience you will ever have. Morale is rock bottom and the people who run the company are clueless - thinking pies to the face is going to solve things. They are strangling the life out of everyone. I don't know anyone who wants to stay here. Turnover is at an all time high. I'm about to leave myself. Gundersen is about to take it over.

pros: decent vacation after years of service
cons: struggling healthcare facility with questionable senior management and financial issues.
